title: Gangplank: Botting or Skill?
body:
Been 2 games now where i've had a {{champion:41}} on the opposite team, 1 where i was laning mid lane against him (can't remember the players name if they were the same or not).

Basically he throws down his first barrel, waits for those 3 bars to drop to a single bar, and then what almost seams simultaneous action, he spawns 2 more barrels and shoots the first at the same time.
Like the 2nd barrel will be placed within range of the first to explode, but in your direction, and the third will be placed within exploding proximity to the 2rd but almost right on top of you. When you stretch 3 barrels out thats a decent area covered in an instant.

Not having played much GP, i'm wondering is this even possible? To place barrels 2 and 3, and shoot the first what seems like at EXACTLY the same time?
Is this some sort of easy thing to do, or is someone actually running a GP script of some kind?

I have the replay saved, just trying to figure out how to get it here to post etc

replies.body:
LOL.

It's a pretty normal Gangplank mechanic dude. It's called the triple barrel and it's all about timing your barrels correctly. There's no scripting or botting going on here.

Ok, thanks for the info. Even on the .25 slow mo replay it looks insanely difficult to press spell button, click where you want it, press spell button and click first barrel to shoot it, press spell button for third barrel and click where you want it... All in less than half a second.
But I guess if this is normal for a good GP then I take my hat off to those that can do it. Because that is just insane hand-eye coordination in my books

I might head to a private game soon and try it out myself... End up looking like shooter mcgavin practising happy gilmores run and swing technique in private and looking like a complete wanker in the process lol
Yeah you pretty much have to place the third barrel as you're detonating the first. Completely catches most off guard if they're not careful.
any good {{champion:41}}  does this. pretty common
